result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua B. Adamski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Jail credit of 1 day if revoked.

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 15CF44

miscConds.notes: No contact with HN.  No contact with AC without her and agent's consent.  Not to consume, use or possess any street drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Follow rules of probation.  Pay costs of supervision.  Submit DNA sample.  Domestic violence assessment and other conditions/programming per agent.

timeConds.notes:
OR 240 HOURS OF COMMUNITY SERVICE TO BE COMPLETED BY 05/15/2016.  Defendant chose to do community service.  Huber privileges granted.
05/19/2016:  Terminated from Community Service; must serve 26 days jail.
